moves.2... Nc6 3. d4 cxd4 4. cxd4 g6: I am unsure if black played 4..;g6 then ;...d6 or 4...;d6  ...;g6
moves.6... Bg7: And here I was unafraid of my opponent's dark squared bishop, so I continued developing
moves.7. O-O: giving my king shelter. This pays off!
moves.7... Qb6: !! Now I am afraid! I am going to lose my d pawn. I can not move my dark squared bishop to e3 because of his queen able to capture my b pawn. What was I to do?
moves.8. Nc3: Well there was nothing I could do but count my lost and continue playing.
moves.8... Nxd4 9. Nxd4 Qxd4: ?! Best move? Was my opponent trying to go into a endgame? Yes he won a free pawn but his attack came at a price! I surely was not going to trade queens and I thought his queen was misplaced there on d4.
moves.10. Qb3 e6: I sure some of you folks can FEEL the attack coming! If not, notice I have two develop pieces and castled. While black has one and has not yet castled. Also, his queen is misplaced.
moves.11. Nb5 Qc5 12. Be3 Qc6: Do you FEEL the attack? The sacrifice? The open file? attack on a uncastled king?
moves.13. Nxd6+: !! My winning move. I FELT this move!

gameName: Winning with the Alapin(2.c3) aginst the Sicilian
